context.description: Events page Use the Events page of the IBM Integration test client to interact with the message flows that you are testing and view the results.
Deployment Location Select the name of the server where you want to deploy your message flows. For example, IBM Integration Bus .

Events page - Detailed Properties In the Message flow drop-down list, select the name of the message flow that you want to test. Selecting the Message flow link opens the selected message flow in the message flow editor. Use the value editor to specify values for the event definition that you are testing. To specify values for a property or extended data element, position your cursor in the Value column and type a value that is appropriate for the type specified in the Type column. To specify values for arrays, right-click the name of the array in the Name column and select Add Element, then expand the array and specify values for the individual fields for the array elements.
General event Use the source or value editor to view values that were passed to the message flow that you are testing. The values are displayed in the Value column when the value editor is selected.
HTTP Information event An HTTP Information Event indicates that the test client has successfully initiated a Send Message operation from the HTTP Input node of a message flow.
HTTP Response event An HTTP Response Event indicates that the test client has successfully captured the response of the HTTP Reply node of a message flow during test execution.
HTTP Exception event This is the name of the HTTP exception class and trace that contain the exception message.
MQ Information event An MQ Information Event indicates that the test client has successfully initiated a Send Message operation from the MQ Input node of a message flow.
MQ Response event An MQ Response Event indicates that the test client has successfully captured the response in output queues that are being monitored in a message flow during test execution.
MQ Exception event This is the name of the MQ exception class and trace that contain the exception message.
JMS Information event A JMS Information Event indicates that the test client has successfully sent a JMS message.

JMS Response event A JMS Response Event indicates that the test client has successfully captured the responses in JMS output destinations that are being monitored in a message flow during test execution.

JMS Exception event A JMS Exception Event indicates that when the test client attempts to send JMS message, it encounters an error that cause the flow to stop processing. The detailed properties of an HTTP Exception Event show the exception message and detailed tracing.
Trace event A Trace Event in the test client follows a message flowing over a connection, within a message flow, during test execution. A Trace Event happens only when tracing is turned on.

Trace Exception event A Trace Exception Event records errors that happen while a message is being processed by a node within a message flow, during test execution. A Trace Exception event happens only when tracing is turned on.
Enqueue event An Enqueue Event indicates that the test client has successfully sent a message to the defined queue manager, host, port, and queue.
Dequeue event A Dequeue event indicates that the test client has captured the first output message from the defined queue manager, host, port, and queue.
Data pool Select the list to which you want to add the element that is specified in the Name field.

Test configuration Use the Configurations page of the IBM Integration test client to edit the test configuration. Expand the test configuration to view the message flows that are included in the test configuration.
Message Flows configuration In the Message Flows configuration section, add and remove message flows to be run in the test.
JMS Settings In the JMS Settings configuration section, define JMS-specific settings to be applied to the test.
MQ Settings In the MQ Settings configuration section, define MQ-specific settings to be applied to the test.
Deployment Settings In the Deployment Settings configuration section, define settings that are associated with deployment of the broker archive in the test.
Test Engine Settings configuration In the test engine settings, customize test behaviors that apply to all test execution.
